intro: Monopetalanthus, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Monopetalanthus is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots and a low-growing habit to conserve water.
